text: Gheorghe Lecca (1831-1885) was a Moldavian-born Romanian politician. Born in Bacău, he was the son of paharnic (royal cup-bearer) Gheorghe Lecca, who died the year after the son was born; and of Maria Negură. Together with his brothers Ioan and Dimitrie, he attended the Cavalry School at Saumur. After returning home in 1854, he took part in the Crimean War. After leaving army service, he served as prefect of Bacău County in 1866, and then as deputy and senator. In early 1882, he was named Finance Minister in the Liberal government of Ion C. Brătianu, serving until his death.Octav George Lecca, Familiile boerești române, p. 318. Bucharest: Editura Minerva, 1899 He had three children with his first wife Mariana Mălinescu, and a son with his second, Clara Negură. Both sons, Caton (1860-1913) and Jean (1863-1898), entered politics. ==Notes== Category:1831 births Category:1885 deaths Category:People from Bacău Category:Romanian nobility Category:Romanian Ministers of Finance Category:National Liberal Party (Romania) politicians Category:Members of the Senate of Romania Category:Members of the Chamber of Deputies (Romania) Category:Prefects of Romania Category:Romanian people of the Crimean War
